author: wsjcom
title: Jane Austen on Sexual Harassment, Vol. III
text:
Prof. Pauline Beard (Letters, Jan. 18) believes that in Jane Austen’s “Pride and Prejudice” Elizabeth has been sexually harassed because “for a man to bring fiery Lizzy to that result [tears]—now that is sexual harassment.” This is an interesting point of view, but unfortunately ill-conceived and naive.
In every human encounter, there are inequalities of power, wealth, age, desire and multiple other variables. To suggest that the mere existence of these differences among us constitutes sexual harassment is silly.
...
